pageContext.claim: “As you know, we were paying them $550 million a year. Now, we’re paying them nothing a year. Because we were -- for years and years, we were being abused by the leadership of the Palestinians and giving them all of this money.”
pageContext.analysis: A Congressional Research Service report from December 2016 says the U.S. provides $400 million a year, not $550 million, in aid for Palestinians. The figure grew to $800 million in 2016 when factoring in direct aid to the Palestinian Authority and the United Nations' Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees, according to Haaretz. Either way, Trump's number is way off. And the U.S. has not cut off aid to Palestinians, despite Trump's assertion.
